context: I spoke negatively about you to other coworkers
letter:
Dear [Colleague's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I want to take a moment to sincerely apologize for my thoughtless comments about you to our coworkers. Reflecting on the situation, I realize how damaging my words can be, not just to your reputation, but also to the sense of trust and respect that we should uphold within our team.

I am truly sorry for any hurt or discomfort I may have caused you. It was wrong of me to speak negatively and I regret not taking the opportunity to address any issues directly with you instead. I value the contributions you make to our work environment, and I realize now that my actions undermined that.

Please know that I am committed to making amends and demonstrating through my actions that I respect and support you. I hope to rebuild the trust that I have damaged, and I'm here to listen if you would like to discuss this further.

Thank you for your understanding. I genuinely appreciate your patience and hope we can move forward positively.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]
